titles.title: Kaloko-Honokohau National Historical Park Addition Act of 2003
A bill to revise the boundary of the Kaloko-Honokohau National Historical Park in the State of Hawaii, and for other purposes.
Kaloko-Honokohau National Historical Park Addition Act of 2003
Kaloko-Honokohau National Historical Park Addition Act of 2003
Kaloko-Honokohau National Historical Park Addition Act of 2003
Kaloko-Honokohau National Historical Park Addition Act of 2003

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported by Senator Domenici without amendment. With written report No. 108-10.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 18.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Recreation and Public Lands.
Subcommittee on National Parks, Recreation and Public Lands Discharged.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Ordered to be Reported by Unanimous Consent.
Reported by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 108-296.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 172.

action.text: Mr. Souder moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 254.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: (This measure has not been amended since it was reported to the Senate on February 11, 2003. The summary of that version is repeated here.)Kaloko-Honokohau National Historical Park Addition Act of 2003 - Modifies the boundaries of Kaloko-Honokohau National Historical Park in Hawaii to include specified lands. Authorizes appropriations.
